intro: Thesium hystrix, commonly known as the prickly thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like structures that cover its stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Thesium hystrix thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
